Scythe is a fantastic game that offers a lot of depth and replayability. The theme, artwork, and mechanics all come together to create a unique and engaging gaming experience. I'm sure Mike and Rachel will appreciate the complexity and strategy involved in playing Scythe.

Before your game night, I recommend taking some time to read through the rulebook and familiarize yourself with the game's components and mechanics. This will help you teach the game to your friends and ensure a smooth gameplay experience.

Additionally, consider setting aside some time to explain the game's objectives, mechanics, and strategies to Mike and Rachel before starting the game. This will help them understand the game's complexity and make the most of their experience.

Remember to have fun and be patient with your friends as they learn the game. Scythe can be a bit overwhelming at first, but once everyone gets the hang of it, it's a really enjoyable game.

If you have any more questions or need further guidance, feel free to ask. Otherwise, I hope you and your friends have an amazing time playing Scythe, and I'm sure you'll create some unforgettable memories together!
